summary:
Here is a summarized version of the Security Council document:

The Security Council,

Noting the tense situation in the Middle East, 
Having considered the report of the Secretary-General on UNDOF, 
Reaffirming resolution 1308 (2000),

Stresses that both parties must abide by the 1974 Disengagement of Forces Agreement and observe the ceasefire. 
Concurs with the Secretary-General that ongoing military activities in the area of separation can escalate tensions and pose a risk to civilians and UN personnel.

Expressing grave concern at violations of the Disengagement of Forces Agreement, 
Strongly condemning recent intense fighting in the area of separation and the use of heavy weapons by both Syrian armed forces and opposition groups.

Condemns the use of improvised explosive devices, 
horrific crimes committed by some armed opposition members, and 
incidents threatening UN personnel safety.

Underscores the need for UNDOF to have necessary means and resources to carry out its mandate safely.

1. Calls on parties to implement resolution 338 (1973).
2. Stresses obligation to respect the 1974 Disengagement of Forces Agreement.
3. Urges parties to prevent military activity in the area of separation.
4. Calls on parties to cooperate with UNDOF operations and ensure its freedom of movement.
5. Welcomes UNDOF efforts to implement zero-tolerance policy on sexual exploitation and abuse.
The Security Council:

 Requests the Secretary-General to continue taking all necessary action to ensure personnel adhere to the UN code of conduct, and to keep the Council informed, and urges troop-contributing countries to investigate and punish any misconduct involving their personnel.

 Decides to renew the mandate of UNDOF for six months, until 31 December 2014, and requests the Secretary-General to ensure UNDOF has the required capacity and resources to fulfil its mandate safely and securely.

 Requests the Secretary-General to report every 90 days on developments and measures taken to implement resolution 338 (1973).
